column2: MARYLAND PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Maryland

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 2. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column4: The driver on the right.
column8: No one.

column2: 3. At a crosswalk:
column4: construction workers must yield to drivers.
column8: drivers must yield to pedestrians.

column2: 4. This sign means:
column4: Roundabout ahead. Slow down.
column6: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column8: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 5. A crosswalk is:
column4: the area where pedestrians may cross the road.
column6: an area designated for blind persons.
column8: a special type of 4-way intersection.

column2: 6. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column4: Warning signs (diamond)
column8: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)

column2: 7. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column6: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column8: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

column2: 8. When a school bus is picking up or dropping off children, you must:
column4: stop if you are driving in the same direction.
column6: stop regardless of your direction of travel.
column8: slow down and pass the bus with caution.

column2: 9. The yield sign means:
column4: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column6: You must come to a complete stop.
column8: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: Do not use your brakes in this area
column8: Warning, curves ahead

column2: 11. To make an emergency stop while driving on an interstate, you should:
column4: get out of the vehicle use hand signals to stop oncoming vehicles.
column6: pull off the road, turn on your emergency flashers and stay in your vehicle if possible.
column8: sound the horn and pull off the road.

column2: 12. These are:
column4: speed limit signs.
column8: miles-left signs.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Crossroads ahead
column8: Railroad Warning

column2: 14. You are driving in the far right lane of a four lane freeway and notice broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving:
column4: on the entrance ramp.
column8: in a special lane for slow moving vehicles.

column2: 15. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column6: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column8: should not speed up or brake quickly.

column2: 16. This sign indicates that:
column4: there's a side road ahead
column6: there is a steep hill ahead.
column8: trucks are merging from the right

column2: 17. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column6: motorcyclesÂ take up less of your field of vision.
column8: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.

column2: 18. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column8: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.

column2: 19. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column8: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.

column2: 20. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: quick lane changes without a signal.
column8: chasing or challenging other drivers.

column2: 21. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column4: black and orange.
column8: green and white.

column2: 22. Which shape is a stop sign?
column4: Upside-down triangle
column8: Octagon

column2: 23. Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?
column4: Cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 24. When changing lanes:
column4: change lane before checking the inside rearview mirror.
column6: look over your shoulder to make sure no one is in the blind spot.
column8: slow down and check your left mirror.

column2: 25. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column6: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column8: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
